task.title: Implement ToolsmithService sync logic
task.description:
## Context
The ToolsmithService orchestrates sync operations across multiple sources and merges results into the catalog. This is the core business logic for catalog management.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 2h
**Approach:** Create service class that coordinates store and sources. Handle merging with update-or-insert logic.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/service.py`
2. Define `SyncResult` model (tools_added, tools_updated, errors)
3. Define `CatalogStats` model (total_tools, by_source, by_type, last_sync)
4. Implement `ToolsmithService.__init__(store, sources)`
5. Implement `sync(source_names=None) -> SyncResult`
   - Fetch from each source (or specified sources)
   - Merge into catalog (update existing by ID, add new)
   - Update sources_synced timestamps
   - Save catalog
6. Implement `stats() -> CatalogStats`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `ToolsmithService` takes store and sources in constructor
- [ ] `sync()` with no args syncs all registered sources
- [ ] `sync(["smithery"])` syncs only specified source
- [ ] Sync updates existing tools (matched by ID) and adds new ones
- [ ] Sync updates `last_sync` and `sources_synced` timestamps
- [ ] `SyncResult` reports tools_added, tools_updated, any errors
- [ ] `stats()` returns catalog statistics
- [ ] Handles source errors gracefully (continues with other sources)
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/service.py` (new)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/models.py` (add SyncResult, CatalogStats)

## Notes
- Tool ID is the unique key for merge logic
- Update `last_seen` timestamp on existing tools during sync
- Consider adding `tools_removed` for tools no longer in source (future)
